node.title: The Heartless, the Spineless, and the Nameless
node.description: Of all those invovled in the death of Jesus, it would seem that the soldiers were the least to blame. But is this true? On a re-evaluation of the texts and the soldier's role, we find that not only were they culpable, but they reveal to us something about human nature and the masses. The evil that we can commit as individuals or as communities when the temperature is right.
